title: issue: FieldErrors Type Can't Handle Optional Properties
body:
### Version Number

7.33.0

Typescript: 4.7.4 (also tried 4.8.0-beta and 4.6.4)

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?ts=4.7.4#code/PTAEDECcHsFtUgUwIYGMAuBaAFtaBrTAM2kngDcB2AOgGZbqAGUACiQBsUBnRAE1ABMAFiYA2agMYCBASgBQiAB4AHUulC9EqdsiSh0AT2WJQAWUSQA5ogA8AQQA0oAEIA+UAF5QAbzmh--1cagTqfZNQgSMDk1Bth2ESAWyXActY8ivNGsYKogSakLoBigAA7qQ+C6NA0KlBunbbrupQHj+ADCpBIBg7AYV435nmGfpyouBg3vqXCuPeHiPmOGbEW+iAfv6LCMRWf71uUyDlBeP5sXWk7DoEmTcYBwGgeBnZQeynKIPBiFgAAMtAqBQnRTgAJJ1I8US7o8OagLAyDKOE6hEGEAbqOguYEfgETQJhUTsGEMTFmElYvuopH7ogl4ACJhEQRAWCU6B0cen4Bue0qXmxHFatxD7MiaL5CSJDJiVlv7-tJ5R+QFQWgDJzF5UuikNreKlqUBIGAVpkHUNBsH6W8QA

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a form type that contains an optional property which can be an array of objects.
2. Read out the error message for an element deeply hidden in the form type with optional chaining.
3. When trying to read out a specific error message within this array of objects, Typescript can't infer anymore that I'm dealing with a list.
4. For the TS Error, see linked TS playground with copied types from the recent version of the library.


### Expected behaviour

By using optional chaining, I want to get the error message for a deeply nested property without adding user-defined type guards (`as unknown as FieldErrors<...>`)

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

### Relevant log output

```shell
Element implicitly has an 'any' type because expression of type '0' can't be used to index type 'FieldError'.
  Property '0' does not exist on type 'FieldError'.
```
